content.raw: I’m going to merge this since if it’s broken after merging, it can’t be any more broken than before merging. But I think when working on sphinx docs I will think about categorising drivers by their maintenance status - unmaintained device code is still a good starting point for anyone wanting to restore support for a device, but if we know the code is highly likely to have bit-rotted, it would be good to flag somewhere that there are no guarantees it still works.
content.html: I’m going to merge this since if it’s broken after merging, it can’t be any more broken than before merging. But I think when working on sphinx docs I will think about categorising drivers by their maintenance status - unmaintained device code is still a good starting point for anyone wanting to restore support for a device, but if we know the code is highly likely to have bit-rotted, it would be good to flag somewhere that there are no guarantees it still works.
